Literature Review: The tumor microenvironment (TME) plays a pivotal role in the pathogenesis and therapeutic resistance of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). Recent studies have highlighted the complex interactions between cancer cells, stromal cells, and the extracellular matrix, which contribute to the heterogeneity and aggressiveness of PDAC. This review aims to summarize the current understanding of the TME in PDAC and discuss its implications for therapeutic strategies.
